title: RFK Jr. Says He Instructed CDC to Change Vaccines and Autism Language on Website
summary: In an interview, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. cited gaps in vaccine safety research. His critics say he is ignoring a larger point: Vaccines save lives.

title: Comey Seeks to Dismiss Charges Based on Grand Jury Errors
summary: The request to dismiss the case came after Lindsey Halligan acknowledged she had never shown a final version of the indictment to the entire grand jury for a vote.

title: Texas Asks Supreme Court to Clear Way for Republican-Friendly Congressional Map
summary: State officials are seeking to use a newly redrawn map for the 2026 midterms, part of a nationwide redistricting push by President Trump.

title: Sean Duffy Asks Travelers to ‘Bring Civility Back’ to Airports in New PSA
summary: The secretary of transportation kicked off a new civility campaign on Wednesday called “The Golden Age of Travel Starts With You.”

title: As Trump Pushes on Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky’s Options Are Narrowing
summary: The Ukrainian president’s options are narrowing as he is confronted with a 28-point proposal drafted by American and Russian envoys.

title: To Many Ukrainians, U.S. Peace Plan Looks Like ‘Capitulation’
summary: While the White House has cautioned that the proposal is still in “flux,” its contours reflect maximalist demands made by Russia throughout the war that Ukraine has consistently rejected.

title: Former Reform U.K. Politician Sent to Prison for Taking Pro-Russia Bribes
summary: Nathan Gill was sentenced to 10 and a half years on Friday after admitting he was paid to make pro-Russian speeches in the European Parliament.

title: Lawrence Krauss, Martin Nowak: The Professors Who Stayed Close With Epstein
summary: Even as the disgraced financier’s crimes were revealed, newly released emails show how academics at top universities stuck by Jeffrey Epstein, often seeking his help and offering it in return.

title: A War Photographer for Whom the Battle Continues
summary: Rockoff, who risked his life to photograph the brutality of the Khmer Rouge, has struggled ever since. Now he says his historic negatives have been taken from him.

title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott Moves to Restrict Muslims, Leaving Some Concerned
summary: Two decisions by the Texas governor this week, including directing authorities to investigate an Islamic organization, come as the state sees an increase in anti-Muslim rhetoric.

title: Eli Lilly, Drug Maker of Zepbound and Mounjaro, Reaches $1 Trillion in Value
summary: The 150-year-old drugmaker is the first company in health care to hit the milestone.

title: Satellite Data Reveals How the U.S. Navy Is Deployed Near Venezuela
summary: The Times identified nearly 100 locations traversed by naval vessels across a two-and-a-half-month period to determine what the military pressure campaign against Venezuela looks like at sea.

title: Watch a ‘Wonderful’ Moment From ‘Wicked: For Good’
summary: The director Jon M. Chu narrates a sequence from his film featuring Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo and Jeff Goldblum performing the song “Wonderful.”

title: How 2 New Songs Made Their Way Into ‘Wicked: For Good’
summary: Each witch gets a new number as part of an effort to flesh out the arc of the stage show’s second act.

title: ‘Wicked: For Good’ — Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo’s Never-Ending Press Tour
summary: The pink-and-green-themed promotions were everywhere, with all the advantages and limitations that kind of marketing push entails.

title: At Least 52 Kidnapped From Nigeria School in Second Mass Abduction This Week
summary: Students and teachers were taken captive from a Catholic school in the latest in a wave of such attacks in the country.

title: The Moon Was an Inside Job
summary: New research suggests that Theia, the object whose collision with Earth is theorized to have caused the formation of the moon, came from closer to the sun.

title: Saturn’s Rings Seem as if They’re About to Disappear: Here’s Why
summary: During the weekend, the orbits of Earth and Saturn will combine to create an interplanetary optical illusion for anyone with a good telescope and clear skies.

title: America Is Setting a Trap for Itself
summary: The United States, not China, seems determined to upend the global order.

title: I’m in Venezuela. This Is the True Cost of Trump’s Gunboat Diplomacy.
summary: Trump’s show of force toward Venezuela has created a disastrous political trap — for Venezuelans most of all.

title: Just Two Guys From Queens
summary: Also, Ukraine faces a “difficult choice” on the U.S. peace plan. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: Vanity Fair Is Reviewing Its Ties to Olivia Nuzzi
summary: The magazine, which recently hired the journalist, said it had been “taken by surprise” by new claims in an essay by her former fiancé, Ryan Lizza.

title: 3 Children Are Injured in Grizzly Bear Attack in British Columbia
summary: The children were among 11 people who were hurt when a grizzly attacked a school group in a remote part of British Columbia, the authorities said.

title: A Colossal, Hidden Pile of Trash Ignites Outcry in Britain
summary: The discovery of a mountain of garbage near a highway is the latest example of what experts say is a growing problem of criminal organizations profiting from illegal dumping.
